metadata.dc:author: Medina Pérez, M
García Carriazo, M
Sánchez González, M
Mompean, F O
Valero Puerta, J A
Valpuesta Fernández, I
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To describe an additional case of metastatic bladder tumor from gastric signet-ring cell adenocarcinoma. METHODS/RESULTS Local recurrence was demonstrated by gastrointestinal endoscopy and biopsy in a 52-year-old female who underwent total gastrectomy for signet-ring cell gastric adenocarcinoma two years earlier. A CT scan showed bilateral hydronephrosis and diffuse thickening of the bladder wall. Bladder biopsy demonstrated signet-ring cell adenocarcinoma. Palliative treatment with ureteral catheterization was instituted. CONCLUSIONS Signet-ring cell adenocarcinoma of the bladder is usually a primary tumor. Metastatic signet-ring cell adenocarcinoma to the urinary bladder is uncommon.
metadata.dc:title: Metástasis vesical de adenocarcinoma de células en anillo de sello de origen gástrico.
[Bladder metastasis of signet-ring cell adenocarcinoma from the stomach].
